frame.name: Offshoot
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame refers to a part of an organization that becomes separate from the main body. The part is usually partially or even wholly autonomous, and may eventually become larger than the body from which it originated. <ex>Methodism is an an <t>offshoot</t> of the Church of England</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Original_body
FE.definition: <def-root>The body from which the Offshoot is derived.</def-root>

FE.name: Branch
FE.definition: <def-root>The offshoot or branch of the original body which differs from it in some important respect.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place in which the <fen>Branch</fen> is locate or where it first forms.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Branch</fen> forms or thrives.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: offshoot.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A branching off from an organization or institution; a subgroup which is differentiated from the main body of the organization and does not exactly follow the actions or beliefs of the members of main body, but has some degree of autonomy.

lexUnit.name: faction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a subgroup sharing opinions or goals which differ from those of the larger group, especially, such a group within a political party.

lexUnit.name: breakaway.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: describing a subgroup having different opinions or goals which attempts to separate itself from the main group and operate independently. <ex>A small group of employees formed a breakaway company and competed with their former employers.</ex>

lexUnit.name: sect.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a subgroup within a religion based on different beliefs from the majority, usually leading to a separate organization. <ex>Christianity began as a Jewish sect.</ex>

lexUnit.name: splinter group.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a faction having ideological differences with the larger group; usually in the political domain.
